intro: Crassula capitella subsp. enantiophylla, commonly known as the "Coral Cactus," is a compact, succulent plant native to South Africa. It features dense clusters of fleshy, blue-green leaves that form a low-growing rosette. The plant produces striking red or pink flowers during the summer months, adding visual interest. It is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy leaves. Due to its unique appearance and ease of care, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and indoor cultivation.
